text: Setup Put all of the bottles of drink on a large, clean table with plenty of cups for the children to create evil smelling concoctions to drink. Use a disposal tablecloth to save your table top from becoming a sticky mess. Wrap a cheese string around a piece of melon. Use a toothpick to hold them in place. Arrange the cheesy-melon bites on a plate or cover half a potato in aluminium foil, place that flat side down on a plate and push the cocktail sticks of your bites a little way into the potato in an attractive hedgehog design. Make strawberry and cream sandwiches. Onto the good white bread put diced bits of strawberry and the cream/condensed milk on. Put another piece of bread on top to create a sandwich. Cut the slices sandwiches into halves or quarters. Cut straight for squares and diagonally for triangles. Arrange these on a platter or plate to serve. Prepare porridge sandwiches or butties.Put porridge between. Make sure it doesn't ooze out of the side! Add on to the mini cheese flavoured crisps grape halves. They taste totally yummy! Smear ketchup, Marmite or Vegemite onto chocolate chip biscuits. Marmite works best, allegedly. Making It a Surprise When the children arrive don't let them see the food. Just play party games with them until they are tired and hungry. Take the children to where the food is and tell them to dig in and make funny drinks and to enjoy everything.  Finish with a cup of hot chocolate. At the end it is best to give them hot chocolate to make them sleepy after a fun, energetic, weird party!
